definition: springtime bamboo shoots/fig. (of woman's fingers) tender and delicate
lit. after rain, the spring bamboo (idiom); fig. rapid new growth/many new things emerge in rapid succession

sentences.english: You know, these years, small-and-medium-sized enterprises appear like bamboo shoots after a spring rain.
sentences.chinese: 這些年來，中小企業像雨後春筍般湧現。

sentences.english: The bamboo shoots in spring crop out after rain.
Good ideas rise to the top in this new idea marketplace.
sentences.chinese: 好主意在這個創意市場上如雨後春筍般湧現。

sentences.english: At the later stage, more and more steamboat restaurants have sprung along Beach Road, Bugis.
sentences.chinese: 後來，美芝路的火鍋店如雨後春筍般越來越多。

sentences.english: Shopping malls selling designer clothes and luxury hotels have sprung up.
sentences.chinese: 購物中心出售時尚成衣，豪華旅館如雨後春筍。

sentences.english: Braised lion's head with bamboo shoots.
Bilateral free-trade agreements are sprouting like weeds.
sentences.chinese: 雙邊自貿協定的湧現如雨後春筍。

sentences.english: The problem of illegal waste dumping has mushroomed in the last decade. ;
sentences.chinese: 非法傾倒垃圾的問題，在最近十年來如雨後春筍。

sentences.english: Charitable projects aimed at supporting the children are mushrooming in many parts of the country.
sentences.chinese: 旨在幫助兒童的慈善項目如雨後春筍般在全國發展。

sentences.english: City industries have sprung up like mushrooms after rain since liberation.
sentences.chinese: 解放後，城市工業雨後春筍般興起。

sentences.english: Moreover, high-rise buildings springing up along the road going up.
sentences.chinese: 而且，路兩旁的高樓大廈如雨後春筍拔地而起。

definition: to begin to stir (idiom)/to get restless/to become threatening
nothing more beautiful can be imagined (idiom)
to blossom everywhere/to spring up all over the place/to flourish on a large scale
lit. hiding the sky and covering the earth (idiom); fig. earth-shattering/omnipresent/of universal importance
more than one can attend to (idiom)/deluged (with inquiries etc)/overwhelmed (by the beauty of the scenery)
to bloom/to blossom/to flower/fig. to burst open/to feel happy or elated/new development grows out
thousands of purples and reds (idiom); a blaze of color/fig. a profusion of flourishing trades
